page.title: 10MONKGROVE COPSE PUTTENHAM
page.content:
Eighteen hectares of ancient woodland called{Monkgrove Copse}have been bought by{Puttenham Golf Club}to extend the course. The Club say that Puttenham course is shorter than the average and also that the re_arranged holes would make it safer for both players and walkers on the Heath.
Some local people want to save the trees, flowers and wild life from being destroyed. They say the Nature Conservancy Council have listed the copse as a site of special scientific interest and want to save it for the badgers, foxes, deer, squirrels, birds and insects etc. They also say half of the woodland in Surrey has been lost in the last thirty years. The local Council is expected to decide what will happen to the copse later in 1985.
